title: Display Font Bold Strong Industrial
content:
I'm interested in knowing which two fonts are being used in these logos. They look very similar but some letters differ from the others. Your time is greatly appreciated, thank you.

[Strength Guys](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457/http:/behance.vo.llnwd.net/profiles7/569741/projects/10302923/34c1dad6ea989e7c1d7c1cbf9320c600.jpg)  
 [Vintage Industrial](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457/http:/behance.vo.llnwd.net/profiles7/569741/projects/6241613/ba100468be6fb47a77fa0e7e71ed70a0.jpg)

Font: 

 Outage 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: zerimar3

comments.content:
Actually, there is more than one single font per logo.  
THE STRENGTH GUYS: main lettering is [Outage](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457/http:/www.losttype.com/font/?name=outage), hard to say for me the 2 other ones.  
VINTAGE INFUSTRIAL: I'm pretty convinced you'll find it out in this [post](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457/http:/typophile.com/node/105488#comment-562631). Without too much thinking, I guess [United](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection) Sans and Serif should do you job for both lettering and digit.

Ryuk, thank you for your reply. I am only looking for the main-title type. I believe [Outage](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457/http:/www.losttype.com/font/?name=outage) is on target for THE STRENGTH GUYS and for VINTAGE INDUSTRIAL, I would say is [Liberator](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457/http:/www.losttype.com/font/?name=liberator). I had looked at [United Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection) on HI but the "I" differs, however, it may be used for the digit and other letters.

Would you happen to know the type in the image below for the cinema/theatre name that says "Oriental"? It looks very near to something like Outage again, but unsure. Thanks again for your help.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cinema_5541.png)

Sorry, can't name it but doubt it could be a font. Most of signages and neon letterings are custom but... [Jeff Levine](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/Jeff_Levine) has done many digitizations of these signages. Here are some, in the same vein with a main difference on /A (but easy to reconstruct from /O top half part): [Waite Park](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/waite-park), [Sign Production](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/sign-production)

Amazing! Thanks for pointing me in the right direction. These are some very nice type faces. I'm looking at [Home Room JNL](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/home-room/regular/) as well as [Eckhardt Poster Display JNL](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/eckhardt-poster-display/).

They remind me of [Liquor Store](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/liquorstore/) by [Chank Diesel](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063457/http:/chank.com/index.php) which is another option I'm considering.

My plate is full and I'm going to see which one fits best. Thanks for your time, it's greatly appreciated!
